longDescription: The shofar is a ritual horn instrument used in Jewish religious observance, made from the horn of a kosher animal, most commonly a ram. The instrument produces a powerful, primal sound that has echoed through Jewish worship for over three thousand years, serving as a call to repentance, a reminder of divine covenant, and a symbol of God's presence in human affairs.
name: Shofar
primarySources: Hebrew Bible, particularly Genesis 22, Exodus 19, Leviticus 23, Numbers 10, Joshua 6
Mishnah Rosh Hashanah. Various translations and commentaries
Babylonian Talmud, Tractate Rosh Hashanah. Soncino or Artscroll editions
Maimonides. Mishneh Torah, Laws of Shofar. Various translations
